intro: Taraxacum sinotianschanicum, commonly known as the Chinese dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, hairy leaves and a hollow, leafless stem that supports a single flower head. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy white seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. Native to China, it thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
